Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 4th overall pick, by Los Angeles in 1967...
Injured on 6/19/1967 with a Sprained Ankle, out for 4 days...
Injured on 6/14/1970 with a Strained Achilles Tendon, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit (triple) on 4/1/1971, off Bill Graham (CHC)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/27/1971, off Jack Billingham (ATL)...
Injured on 7/19/1971 with a Strained Achilles Tendon, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won World Series with Los Angeles in 1971...
Was selected to the 1972 Allstar game...
Had 5 hits with 7 RBI against Cincinnati on 4/28/1973...
Was selected to the 1973 Allstar game...
Traded from Los Angeles to Chicago (A) on 3/2/1974 (Going to LA: 3B M. Kakefu, P D. Vossler, RF C. Lemon. Going to CHW: C C. Fisk, RF R. Jackson, P J. James, P D. Eddy, P F. Jenkins)...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/14/1974, hitting .538 with 1 HR, 6 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/23/1974, hitting .450 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
